comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Virginia Myers (21 October 1906-) was a dancer before she was five years old. Her parents were artists in New York City (Jerome Myers was a painter, Ethel Myers was a sculptor), who encouraged their daughter's expressive movements with private, and eventually public, exhibitions. She danced for an early film. In 1916, there was a Vanity Fair article about her. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jerome_Myers en.wikipedia.org/wiki/User:BEDownes/Ethel_Myers ques.com/myers/html/virginia.html www.imdb.com/title/tt1056052/ A much later photo of her, still dancing: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/agc1996000079/PP/ This photo was used in a 1913 article about her, in Vogue: ques.com/ArtResearch/When%20Virginia%20Dances%20-%20Vogue...

comment.author: 48908095@N02
comment._content: Surprised I have never heard of her!  Thanks for the research, Penny.
